title: Wanted: Free Contrasty Sans
content:
I have a friend whose client is looking for a contrasty sans under free license. Please rest assured that I’ve advised both parties concerning the typical limitations of free fonts, but I do know there are some gems out there, and this deal does serve a higher purpose, so I hope some good recommendation will be forthcoming. Thank you!

hhp

author: hrant

comments.content: Hrant, you once helped me to finish [Fontin](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907005406/http:/typophile.com/node/4372). I also made a sans of it. It’s free for commercial use. Here’s the [link](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907005406/http:/www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/fontinsans.html).

I second Fontin. It looks good and I’ve seen it hold up on the most incredibly awful paper/press combination known to man.

And while not free, Stone Sans and Stone Humanist Sans are only $59 a family from [www.stonetypefoundry.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907005406/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/ "www.stonetypefoundry.com").
